UI_visible_response: "Wolf Warrior Diplomacy" is a term used to describe a new and assertive style of Chinese diplomacy characterized by particular assertiveness and aggressiveness1. This approach, adopted by Chinese diplomats in the 21st century, involves an aggressive style of coercive diplomacy2. It addresses domestic political climate, world power dynamics, and national interests using authoritative language and nationalism3. Externally, it serves as propaganda to oppose any external threats and criticisms considered key challenges to China4. The emergence of “wolf warrior diplomats” symbolizes the incursion of cyber-nationalist preferences for a hard-edged foreign policy posture5. This concept and practice are justified by the “fight for discourse power” and are seen as part of major-country diplomacy6. It also serves to project an image of a confident and powerful China that is unafraid to assert its interests and challenge others7. With its combative approach and aggressive rhetoric, it caters to expectations by showcasing China's strength8.
traffic_visible_response: "Wolf Warrior Diplomacy" is a term used to describe a new and assertive style of Chinese diplomacy characterized by particular assertiveness and aggressiveness [[1]]. This approach, adopted by Chinese diplomats in the 21st century, involves an aggressive style of coercive diplomacy [[2]]. It addresses domestic political climate, world power dynamics, and national interests using authoritative language and nationalism [[3]]. Externally, it serves as propaganda to oppose any external threats and criticisms considered key challenges to China [[4]]. The emergence of “wolf warrior diplomats” symbolizes the incursion of cyber-nationalist preferences for a hard-edged foreign policy posture [[5]]. This concept and practice are justified by the “fight for discourse power” and are seen as part of major-country diplomacy [[6]]. It also serves to project an image of a confident and powerful China that is unafraid to assert its interests and challenge others [[7]]. With its combative approach and aggressive rhetoric, it caters to expectations by showcasing China's strength [[8]].
